doc.previous: where is the tangent of the Poiseuille parabola intersecting the wall Although L v que s solution was specific to heat transfer into a Poiseuille flow his insight helped lead other scientists to an exact solution of the thermal boundary layer problem 4 Schuh observed that in a boundary layer u is again a linear function of y but that in this case the wall tangent is a function of x 5 He expressed this with a modified version of L v que s profile
doc.after: Paul Richard Heinrich Blasius derived an exact solution to the above laminar boundary layer equations 8 The thickness of the boundary layer is a function of the Reynolds number for laminar flow
